result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Magdalena Anna Soboniak appeared by telephone, in custody.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford appeared by video for Magdalena Anna Soboniak.  Prosecuting Attorney Careen Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Letter to Court Requesting Phone Appearance for Preliminary Hearing

Defendant Magdalena Anna Soboniak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Magdalena Anna Soboniak.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Attorney Paul Crawford recently retained.  Court scheduled the matter for a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Magdalena Anna Soboniak not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Magdalena Anna Soboniak in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Magdalena Anna Soboniak in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
